title: The Words That Sailed Across Half The World (Work in Progress)
description: How the shared linguistic ancestry of Austronesians tell us the story of mankindâ€™s greatest expansion and adversities across the vast Indo-Pacific.

title: 175 Years of the Straits Times' Headlines: Stories that Made The Most Impact
description: Which stories shaped Singapore and the world through the eyes of The Straits Times in the past 175 years?
awards: Award of Excellence - Society for News Design 2020
Shortlisted - The Sigma Awards 2021 for data journalism
Best Data Visualisation (Silver) - Digital Media Awards, Asia 2021

title: Friend or Foe? The Common Interests between Countries of the World Analyzed
description: Which countries would more likely to join the same organizations? This was my final internship project for Interactive Things, a Switzerland based Data Visualization and UX Design studio.

title: Why Singapore's Constituencies' Boundaries Change So Often Since 1968?
description: Analysis of constituency changes in Singapore since 1968. An interactive story for The Straits Times during the Singapore General Elections coverage.
awards: Shortlisted - The Sigma Awards 2021 for data journalism
Infographics of the Year - SPH Journalism Awards 2020, The Straits Times

title: Designing a Device to Help Farmers Adapt to Climate Change (Concept)
description: Designing a low-cost weather forecasting device for farmers without the need to read anything, inly through blinking lights. A winning article I wrote for Predictable Designs, a hardware and product development blog.
awards: Winner: Most Innovative Project - Predictable Designs

title: 10 Years of "Exclusive" Economic Growth
description: Looking at the concentration of growth between the capital and the regional provinces in the Philippines.
awards: Longlisted: Kantar Information is Beautiful Awards

title: Where All The Tourists From And Where They Mostly Go?
description: Visualizing the trends on tourists and travel destinations in the Philippines by local and foreign tourists.

title: Is The Data Visualization Community Diverse Enough?
description: Is your background rare in the community of data visualization professionals and enthusiasts?
awards: 3rd in Exploration: DVS Community Survey 2019 Challenge

title: The Ever Increasing Income Gap Between The Rich and The Poor Visualized
description: Visualizing income inequalities between countries and between income groups within countries. Created during my internship at Interactive Things.
awards: 2nd place: 2019 Human Development Data Visualization Challenge

title: Designing a Public Jeepney Transport Map for a Unique Mode of Transport
description: Designing a map for the ever complex chaotic public jeepney transport in Cebu City, Philippines with a similar New York style public transport map.

title: Learning Electronics Made Fun With Visual Cheatsheets
description: TinkrPostr was made out of boredom. The ever technical electronics made not boring anymore with eye-catching and engaging visual material.

title: Visualizing How European Countries Voted in Eurovision from 2012 to 2017
description: Which countries voted which countries in Eurovision? A fun personal project using Processing.
